HOTEL THE CELESTINE KYOTO GION
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 138 reviews

It's a brand new 5 star hotel (opened in September 2017). The location is just perfect for us as we had gotten the hotel to make most of our restaurants reservations, mostly around the GION district area.

Quite a number of sightseeing places (famous Shrines & Temples) are within walking distance. It is especially good for us as we can walk off the calories after our lunch and before heading back to hotel to freshen up and then for dinner. The room size is pretty good and everything is so new and clean.. even the hotel smells good too! Room rate is considered reasonable given the high rates in most hotels in Kyoto. Overall,we are happy and satisfied with the stay at Celestine Kyoto Gion. The only problem (not big though) is you have to be rather patience with the staff if communicating in English with them. Anyway, will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Show more
Geraldine , Singapore
Kyoto Century Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 1745 reviews

We chose this hotel for location, close to JR station, making it convenient to travel day trips by JR.

The hotel was newly renovated, so all room and facilities are nice and clean. It is a non smoking hotel. Staff polite and helpful. We were very happy that we got upgraded to a deluxe room, that make our stay even more memorable. The breakfast was excellent although the food is pretty much the same each morning. We had the Valentine' Day dinner in the hotel, and the food was great, over all, a very happy stay. The sink is separated from the toilet/bathroom, which is a convenient design. One minor thing is that there is no soap available next to the sink and we have to go back to the bathroom to squeeze liquid soap to clean up our hands each time after toilet.

Show more
Kwok , Australia
Kyoto Brighton Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 622 reviews

Excelent hotel, not so good location unless one knows about the shuttle bus! The shuttle bus connects to Karasuma Oike subway station which is perfect for both enjoying the city and to get to/from the railway station.

We didn't know about the shuttle bus when we got to the hotel, so we had to walk about 15 minutes under heavy rain. The hotel staff was really nice to relief us from the burden of our luggage and also provide umbrellas once they saw us. The hotel is excelent, the staff knows great English, the room was big and with all the facilities one would expect from a 5 star hotel. Great value for the money I would say. Also worth to know that the hotel is close to the Kyoto Imperial Palace Gardens, which provide an excelent place for a morning jogging and also for a very relaxing walk at any time of day and weather.

Show more
Dragos , Romania
Hotel Gracery Kyoto Sanjo
9.3 Exceptional
Based on 458 reviews

This was our first trip to Kyoto and I debated between this hotel and another hotel a little further away with large, designer rooms for a little more money.

So glad we chose this one for its location. Lots of good shops right outside door in pedestrian zone (though that means taxi won't be able to drop or pick up immediately in front of hotel) and excellent restaurants within walking distance. Nishiki market nearby and Gion about 10-15 minute walk. Subway station ~12 minutes walk. Rooms were comfortable and clean but tight.

Show more
Frank , United States
Hotel M's Plus Shijo Omiya
8.9 Excellent
Based on 1035 reviews

I lost my backpacker in JR West train from KIX to Kyoto. I requested the hotel front desk a staff to enquire the JR 's parties to check any loss and found in the train.

He told me as the counter was closed on 20:00 and will enquire them on tomorrow. As my Japanese language is poor and tell me the backpacker color and what time lost in express. Who promised me should checking​ it. Next day we go to sightseeing Kyoto and back to hotel on afternoon to hearing any good news. Unfortunately, he are not on duty and only simple memo said that not found replied by JR's. So sad, I decided to go to Kyoto JP station on next day and want to enquire this. The JR staff replied can contact their lost and found department on station to check any lost and found but they are closed on 1930. Next day I contact lost and found department and they found my backerpacker. So, have hotel staff is take any action to help me or skimp me to destroy my found my lost opportunity in due course!

Show more
Wing , Hong Kong
Hotel Gran Ms Kyoto
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1411 reviews

Initially chose this hotel based on reviews and price. The reviews seemed to repeat two things: amazing location and the free washer/dryer service! 1.

The location was truly GREAT. Central Kyoto's shopping street was literally 50m away from the lobby. Teramachi Shopping Arcade (2min walk), Sanjo station (5min walk), Gion/Pontocho (10min walk). We were also surrounded by restaurants, bakeries and shops. It was great. 2. The washer/dryer service on level 2 really did come in handy! English instructions available, easy to follow. 3. 15 min taxi ride from Kyoto station (1000-1500 yen) 4. The room was very clean and also quite small! It's definitely efficient. As two Asian ladies, we fit just fine. Toiletries/towels were lovely and replenished daily, along with complimentary bottled water. Overall a great stay (especially for Kyoto first-timers), would definitely come back during our next Kyoto visit!

Show more
Christelle , Singapore
Hotel New Hankyu Kyoto
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3109 reviews

Location is the best. Just across the underground path, the entrance will right in front of you. You can access JR and department store very easily.

Bus interchange and Kyoto tower is right at the corner. The best thing is there is a Super big shopping mall behind the hotel, you can find everything you need there. We are a group of four, so we booked a linked room ( two rooms linked together). The room is comfy and cozy. We only stayed here for one day, but we did enjoyed our stay! If there comes another chance to visit Kyoto again, I'll definitely choose here again.

Show more
Chen , Taiwan
Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Kyoto Premier
9.3 Exceptional
Based on 362 reviews

My family of five had a wonderful stay at this property. Our three kids, 14, 12, & 10, had a room around the corner in a twin + rollaway, it was called a triple.

My partner and I shared a twin double, which two beds were pushed together (I don't quite get this, but it worked out just fine). We were located on the 2nd floor, which was free of any of the smoke issues as reported by other reviewers. My opinion is, that if you are concerned with smoking as I am, you really have to call a manager on the property, and ask what their policies are on smoking. Japan is still a country in transition when it comes to the definition of a "non-smoking room". The entire property is very clean, and well appointed. The location is excellent --between the bustle of downtown and gion. The property sits alongside the riverside, and is a block away from the two major subway lines. Hint, the subway passes are different between the two systems :) Runners and bikers (another hint, rent a bike and ride along the river paved paths) will love this location. Adults will love the public baths... The rooms are "cozy", but on par with other boutique hotels. The triple rooms were tight on space. The twin, had a small couch and table. There is a washer dryer on site (one on the mens side, and two on the women's). the women's machine is available only to women. The english of the staff can be a little rough, but there was always someone available who could come in and help a poor english only speaking person like myself. The breakfast is EXCELLENT. However, unless it is included for free, I would suggest that you purchase it on your first morning... and then forage outside afterwards in the many options in the neighborhood. I think it's about ~2500 yen. It's just a lot of food! Do take advantage of the hotel's excellent, knowledgeable, thoughful concierge. They also have a fancy coin machine, which my kids loved, that will convert your bag full of coins into larger more

Show more
michael , United States
HOTEL MYSTAYS Kyoto-Shijo
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3375 reviews

This hotel was not really near any train stations. It was about a 10 minute walk from Shijo subway station.

The hotel was nice though. It is in a nice area within walking distance of a lot of restaurants and a nice shopping area. The city of Kyoto is absolutely amazing. We just wished it was a bit easier to get to this hotel. Overall it was a nice stay.

Show more
Richard , United States
RIHGA Royal Hotel Kyoto
8.5 Excellent
Based on 1114 reviews

I really have nothing to complain about this hotel in terms of the room, the facilities and the staff.

The room is really big for a Japanese hotel, maybe because this is a 4 star hotel, well equipped, it has a large enough bathtub to fit an adult (most hotel bathtubs in Japan are like for hobbits or kids), has a nespresso machine in the room with 4 capsules (refilled daily), has a nice swimming pool. And the breakfast is really nice. The only complain I have about the hotel is that it is too far from Kyoto station (12 minutes walk, contrary to the 7-9 minute walk indicated on their website and Google Maps *maybe Google Maps expects you to run* ). It's okay if you are a business traveler, group of friends or young couple. You can also take a shuttle bus, but make sure you check the pick-up point and the timings, the pick-up point is on the Shinkansen side of the Station. Given the price and facilities, I do plan to stay here again in the future.

Show more
Zhi , Singapore
Hotel Monterey Kyoto
8.5 Excellent
Based on 1592 reviews

We stayed at Hotel Monterey Kyoto for 3 nights at the end of our trip to Japan. Because we waited too long to book reservations, we had limited choices.

The hotel is located about a 7 minute taxi ride from Kyoto Station in a commercial section of Kyoto. Our room was mis-assigned (not the hotel's fault) and the first night we had a triple room in a room meant for 1-2 beds. Hotel staff corrected that for night's 2 and 3. The room was okay. Carpet needs cleaning, but the room was clean. The bathroom was fully stocked and had a shower in tub. The optional buffet breakfast featured a large selection of foods from Japanese to western style foods. There are 2 restaurants on site, very expensive. The decor is unusual - it's a Scottish themed hotel with Japanese influences. Dark woods throughout. Hotel does not offer money exchange services on site. Staff was courteous and helpful as one would expect.

Show more
Janice , United States
Mitsui Garden Hotel Kyoto Shijo
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1510 reviews

Good location. Reasonably clean. Functional but certainly not a 4-star hotel as claimed. More like 3-star.

Our triple room is very small. Fortunately. We only had a small carry-on luggage per person. We kept bumping, literally, into one another when moving around in the tiny room. The room is also every dark because the window looks out to the wall of an apartment building next door about 8 feet away. We asked if we can be moved to a room that we can at least see a little bit of the sky. The reception staff advised that because the hotel is surrounded by apartment buildings, the other rooms are similar and would not offer much different vision of the outside (i.e. wall views only).

Show more
Susanna , United States
Hotel Granvia Kyoto
9 Excellent
Based on 1444 reviews

The JR station in Kyoto is a city within itself, and the Hotel Granvia is the Manor House. The place is immense.

Upon arrival, looking out from a window onto the city, the thought of venturing into the streets on foot was daunting. How long would it take to escape the station complex and start a walking tour was an uncomfortable thought. The Granvia concierge was excellent in English and cheerful and patient in marking up a city map for us, but still we were stumbling around for a while. Nevertheless, we finally found the subway entrance, and finally got some help in purchasing fare tickets, and arrived at our destination. The concierge advice was very useful, giving us transportation choices, and indeed we used the loop bus #100 to return to the station. (Notable advice: if there is a ticket machine at the bus boarding area, take a ticket; if none exists, the fare is fixed price for any destination. The fare machine next to the driver makes change for bank notes, and the driver will help you by taking coins from your hand to match the required fare. We formed up at the end of the line so as to not delay all the other passengers who knew the system well.) On check-in be mindful of which elevators to use. North lifts serve some room numbers, and South serves others. Hotel Granvia offers three breakfast locations, and we chose the buffet. Good choice. Self-service latte etc coffee machine and variety to satisfy anyone. Before 8AM it is crowded with significant waiting time. Checkout is busy early in the morning, but at 9AM+ it was fast and easy. Lobby seating is insufficient if you have to wait for a train or something.

Show more
chanpen , Thailand
Natural Hot Spring Dormy Inn Premium Kyoto Ekimae
8.8 Excellent
Based on 2062 reviews

My wife and I were lucky to find a room at Dormy Inn in Kyoto just after the new year. The first few days before and after the new year are the busy days in Kyoto.

Dormy Inn is just a few steps away from the Kyoto Station North exit. The cleanliness of the room and friendliness of the staff was excellent. By the way, the room where we stayed was roomy and comfy. My wife and I enjoyed the hot springs which were open from 3pm to 9am. A complimentary bowl of Ramen was available in the evening.The WIFI connected was also very good. The bus station and subway stop are also a few steps away. We recommend getting a day or two day bus and subway pass to see the Kyoto attractions. Having the pass would save you a lot of walking.There are a lot of good restaurants nearby (all kinds not just Japanese or Asian) - at the train station/mall area. We highly recommend Dormy Inn if you are going to visit Kyoto.

Show more
Renato , United States
Royal Park Hotel The Kyoto
8.9 Excellent
Based on 1075 reviews

About a 15 minute ride from the Bullet train station. The staff was very friendly and spoke a little English.

The room was a little small, but it is Japan. Beds were OK,for twin beds, we had them together. I preferre a bit softer bed, but all good. We had upgraded to a bigger room and the bathroom was great size, loved the heated toilet seats, very nice. The bar was nice and the food in the restaurant was great at dinner. We ate breakfast next door at the pastry shop that served a great American type breakfast.(I love my breakfast) They also had "Stollen" a great German type of bread for Christmas time. yummo. The Hotel overall was clean and very friendly staff, our 2nd day here we came across Brent who was American and helped us with site seeing trips around town. We had a good visit and the Hotel made it a comfortable place to enjoy.

Show more
Sharon , United States
Hotel Kanra Kyoto
9 Excellent
Based on 614 reviews

Perhaps one of the nicest places to stay in Kyoto. We had the cheapest most basic room with one bed for 2 people, and I will have the say the room was amazing, even by western standards.

Japanese rooms are typically small but our place was spacious. It had a very minimal but modern design which we really enjoyed. This hotel is interesting since all the rooms have a wooden bathtub, if you fill it up with water, the whole shower/bath area will smell like that wood. It really is a "modern-ryokan" in a sense. The WIFI was great, and the customer service was amazing. We were even able to rent bikes for free from this hotel (had to return by 6pm), which were battery powered and really easy to use. Most of the staff speak some sort of English so it is easy to communicate if you are worried about that. If you have the money, I would recommend to stay here. Modern comforts in with a japanese minimalist design make it a great experience.

Show more
Steven , United States
Hotel M's Est Shijo Karasuma
8.9 Excellent
Based on 640 reviews

Hotel is very conveniently located. There is a train station and a subway station just in 2 mins walking distance.

Both stations are only 1 station from Kyoto Central. Most of the attractions are around subway/train stations, hence it gives easy access to attractions. It is close to many attraction points as well. So you can even go in a taxi without breaking a bank :) Also Nishiki Market is just in 5 mins walking distance. Good food!! Rooms are pretty small and tight. But all the facilities are there. If you are carrying baggage you might not find enough space. We only had 2 back packs and a hand luggage. So it was enough space for us. There was a tub in the bathroom/ Small, but you can relax your tiring legs after hours of walking. They also have a laundry room downstairs. Do not have laundry bags. So take something with you to put your dirty clothes Staff is friendly. Speaks good English . Very polite and will help you. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. Mainly because of the location

Show more
Sacheera , Singapore
Hotel Keihan Kyoto GRANDE
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1357 reviews

Between 2016-05-22 and 2016-05-24,my family and I (three persons) staying at The Hotel Keihan Kyoto for sight seeing.

When we arrived at the hotel, we found the room is so small. Only the cleaning worker is nice, the staff of the reception check in counter are seldom smile to customer , At about 14:50 hrs on 2016-05-24, we took the coach at No, 5 terminal of OCAT Kyoto for Osaka. Before we got in the coach, we proceeded to the OCAT reception counter (a lady, about 35 yrs, also without smile) for enquiry can we used the ICOCA card ( store value card) she replied that you can. Finally the coach arrived in OCAT Terminal, OSaja at about 16:15 hrs, we used the ICOCA card paid for the coach, the driver ( a gentleman, about 50-55 yrs) spoke in Japanese and looked like angry and rude manner. I felt he disliked us to use the store value card to pay the fare or he is discrimination the passenger speaking English. We have an unpleasant experience in Hotel Jeihan Kyoto and The OCAT, Kyoto.

Show more
Steven , Hong Kong
Urban Hotel Kyoto-Nijo Premium
8.8 Excellent
Based on 536 reviews

We were already surprised by the size of hotel room in Japan, so by the time we checked in we already knew this hotel is not out of the norm.

Unless you want to pay more than 200 usd/ night, room size will not be any bigger than this. The room was well designed, so even though it was small, it was very cozy and everything seems new. The location is good. There is a good french restaurant a few doors down. A 7-eleven, pharmacy, laundromat and a supermarket were all within a 5-minute walk. Nijo station is about 2-3 blocks away. Bus stop is right in front of 7-eleven which was like 20 meters away from the hotel and across the street. We could get to Kyoto station either by bus or train. JR train does go to Nijo station, so our JR pass came handy. The hotel has free public bath/ spa that guest can enjoy and on-site laundromat facility. We will stay at this hotel again.

Show more
minh , Vietnam
Daiwa Roynet Hotel Kyoto-ekimae
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 487 reviews

Room is spacious with ample natural light. The twin beds are quite large, although a bit firm. Bathroom is larger than other hotels I've stayed at in Japan, particularly love the bathtub & rainfall shower.

At check in, they have amenities baskets for ladies and children, from which you can take whatever you like, which I thought was special. The staff may seem standoff-ish, but when they know you really need help, they are very helpful. They helped me book an airport limousine bus departing from my next hotel in Tokyo. Location is a 5-10 minute walk from Kyoto Station and just a stone's throw away from Kyoto Tower. The hotel also connects directly to Kyoto Station through the Porta on B1 level, which is convenient when it's raining. However, connecting to the Porta is through a series of steps (no elevator/escalator/ramp), so keep that in mind if you're travelling with a pram/stroller/wheelchair/large suitcase.

Show more
Melanie , Indonesia
APA Hotel Kyoto-Ekimae
7.8 Very good
Based on 1044 reviews

This hotel is a bit pricey compare to the similar leveled hotel. The light is too dim in the room; the room is too small, which you cannot unpack your luggage on the floor; the things is in really bad and non-logical placement in the room (the water boiler is behind the TV), etc.

The English skills of the staffs are not good, it is very hard to communicate if you do not know a bit Japanese. However, they are willing to help. The positive side of this hotel is that it is very close to Kyoto Station, JR and Bus station, which save a lot of time.

Show more
Wing , Hong Kong
Mitsui Garden Hotel Kyoto Sanjo
8.3 Excellent

Francis , United States
Highland Shimabara - Guesthouse in Kyoto -
8.8 Excellent
Based on 376 reviews

Booked for five nights and requested a room at the back of the hotel after reading other reviews about road noise.

It was very quiet. Location is good, with a bus stop literally steps from the front door. NB: from Kyoto station, make sure to catch the 206 from bus bay A3 - this one heads northwest towards Shijo Omiya. Alight at Shimabaraguchi. (The 206 service from bus bay D2 goes northeast towards Gion - we found this out the hard way, with luggage in tow as well!). Fewer nearby restaurants than other, busier parts of Kyoto. Kyoto station is reasonably nearby (15 - 20 mins) with lots of food options - Porta Dining on B1 has plenty of excellent choices. Just southeast of the station (also 15 - 20 min walk) is an AEON mall, with a food floor, including a food court, on the 4th floor. Room is well set-up, and a good size in comparison to a Japanese hotel room. We really appreciated the extra space. It also has an excellent Japanese-style bathroom and a little kitchenette, but definitely BYO kitchen utensils if you want to eat in. Two mugs and some paper cups are provided, there is also a stove-top kettle and small fridge/freezer. The only drawback was that the bed was really hard, I could feel the springs in the mattress. The staff member we met - Masa - was very helpful and spoke good English. The check-in system works very well, especially if you arrive outside of office hours. I would definitely choose to stay here again.

I would have glad to get rid off some of the dust that accumulated over the course of a week. Secondly, why not make available a dish cloth. It doesn't make sense to dry dishes with hand or bath towels, does it? However, otherwise I was pleased with my stay and will not hesitate to stay at Guest Apartment Kyoto Ann when next I am in the area.

Definitely great value for money. The room is quite spacious and comfortableThere's a little balcony that can be used to hang up clothes or simply to open up the space more.

There is a separate kitchenette with all the utensils one needs + washing machine. I like that the toilet and bath/shower are separate and affords some privacy. Location is great either a short walk to a lot of places or an even shorter walk to the bus stops and the Sanjo subway station. They have a facility for luggage storage so you can maximize your time in Kyoto before check-in & after check-out. Didnt really get to interact with staff as the front desk is manned only a limited time during the day. But those we did get to talk to were very friendly and helpful. The reservations team were very thorough in their instructions and very helpful. Would definitely recommend.

Parkside Umekoji Guesthouse in Kyoto
8.9 Excellent
Based on 401 reviews

The location is a bit far from Kyoto Station, so it is better if you are a backpacker rather than rolling your luggage.

Kyoto is an easy place to navigate so overall it is not a big problem. Just round the street corner is Umekoji Park and Kyoto Aquarium. There is a bus stop just right in front of the guesthouse. Room is very clean. Great facilities except that the mattress and pillows are too soft. The mini kitchen has a kettle and 2 mugs but there is nothing for us to stir our instant coffee. Better to travel with a spork. The mini kitchen also has a washing machine and the owner provides washing powder too. There is no dryer but you can hang your laundry in the shower room where there is a room heater. Owner provides plenty of hanger. The toilet is just next to the shower room, separated. But it is quite narrow and small. So if you are a beefcake or a praying mantis, it might be a bit uncomfortable for you. We did our own self check-in, so did not manage to speak to the manager. But we think he is a very thoughtful person as the corridor wall is full of tourist info. There are even tourist brochures. He even provided umbrellas (which I brought out for one rainy day) for guests which you can return at the end of the day. Overall it is a great place to stay for 4 days or more. Highly recommended!

River East Nanajo - Guesthouse in Kyoto
8.9 Excellent

Overall we had a really pleasant stay. My husband loved how efficient the unit was - there is a washing machine but no dryer and instead a way to dry clothes in the shower room (my husband the engineer enjoyed figuring it out and was impressed by the results).

There is a mini kitchen with stove, mini refrigerator and microwave. The location was pretty good. It was about a 15-20 min walk to Kyoto Station and was definitely more of a residential neighborhood vibe. Very close to one metro station which we used for some of our travel in Kyoto but also utilized the buses a lot. As this was my first time in Kyoto based on my experience I can't say if there are other areas in Kyoto that are more convenient for travel throughout the city, so without that knowledge I'd give it a 7-7.5/10 for location. The bed was pretty hard and the pillows pretty thin so in that aspect those items could be slightly improved but overall we enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

Location is a bliss. Short bus ride or a long walk from Kyoto Station. Staff comes in by 9am. Though you can't checkin before 4pm, you may leave your luggage and freshen up in washroom outside before heading out the majestic Kyoto City.

I got a triple sharing room. It is BIG in Japanese standards. Kitchen is full (not the typical one-shelf-kitchen in Tokyo). Beds has a separate room. A PC. A washing machine and iron board. Residential area. You have to walk a little for restaurants. Some vending machines on the road for drinks. Downside, no elevator. They are willing to help with the luggage. Check out is 11am. They can keep your luggage until 5pm. If you're leaving after 5, luggage storage near Kyoto Station will be offered for FREE. This saves you from getting coin lockers.

I rented a bicycle for the day for Y500 (the bike was well maintained as well). After entering the main entrance, climb up to the 4th Floor and there will be a phone there. Call the manager and he will inform you which apartment you have been given and will drop by. 8.2 Excellent

Daily Apartment House Ichijo IVY
7.6 Very good
Based on 110 reviews

The apartment is a 15 minute walk from the closest train station (but Kyoto train system isn't very good anyway), and more importantly close to many useful bus stations with good routes.

The place itself is nice and clean, with large window and lots of light. Make sure you rent bikes from the owner on checkin. $1 a day and you'll use them a lot (riding to the station or shops), they have their own wheel locks attached and are very convenient and one of the best things about Kyoto (check the light generator works when picking one). The girl that met us on checkin was super friendly and very very helpful, great english ask her anything about tourist sites etc. The bed is bad... Really bad. I've slept on bad beds around Asia. This is the worst! Its basically two; only what can describe as 'large type things' pushed together. Its not large enough though really, and although they have soft middles, they have hard edges, which being pushed together, meet right where your back is. So there is a double hard ridge in your back. Like as hard as a metal rod. I'm 5'9 and I only just fit on the 'bed'. You will mess up your back. I like hard beds and have had no problem with any bed in SE Asia.... But this one, seriously. There is a washing machine but I couldn't get it to work because it is only in Korean, no instructions or symbols on it, so that's a huge shame. There is LAN for a laptop but no WiFi if you only have a tablet or phone only. Downstairs there is a wireless router hooked up to the internet but its password locked for reasons unknown, and a login good given to you. The kitchenette is nice and there is a grill and gas hotplates. Not that many restaurants around that part of town, but a short ride to the station (less than 5min on bike) has a few. 7eleven, family mart, and circle k stores close by. Not any English TV channels, but that didn't bother us much. Seriously though... That bed!

More about Kyoto

The former imperial capital, Kyoto is a very important city in Japan's history. Many of the buildings and palaces in Kyoto are thousands of years old and the city is regarded by many to be the most beautiful in Japan. Kyoto has 17 areas listed as UNESCO World Heritage sites, most of which are temples and shrines like Kinkaku Temple.

Kyoto Station is a popular entry point into the city and, as with most of Japan, the rail network provides access to all the city's most important sites. The two most impressive imperial retreats, Imperial Palace and Sentō Imperial Palace, are located in central Kyoto. The gardens are extensive and particularly beautiful during cherry blossom season and in autumn when the colors of the leaves change.

Katsura Imperial Villa is located in Western Kyoto and Shugakuin Imperial Villa is located in the north. Kyoto's nightlife is concentrated around the Kiyamachi area in central Kyoto. There are hundreds of bars ranging from pubs to exclusive bars all throughout the area, as well as restaurants and night clubs. Kyoto is a city rich in history and charm, and visitors to this area will not be in want of exciting and interesting activities.

There’s much more to see and learn about Kyoto, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.

Its not large enough though really, and although they have soft middles, they have hard edges, which being pushed together, meet right where your back is. So there is a double hard ridge in your back. Like as hard as a metal rod. I'm 5'9 and I only just fit on the 'bed'. You will mess up your back. I like hard beds and have had no problem with any bed in SE Asia.... But this one, seriously. There is a washing machine but I couldn't get it to work because it is only in Korean, no instructions or symbols on it, so that's a huge shame. There is LAN for a laptop but no WiFi if you only have a tablet or phone only. Downstairs there is a wireless router hooked up to the internet but its password locked for reasons unknown, and a login good given to you. The kitchenette is nice and there is a grill and gas hotplates. Not that many restaurants around that part of town, but a short ride to the station (less than 5min on bike) has a few. 7eleven, family mart, and circle k stores close by. Not any English TV channels, but that didn't bother us much. Seriously though... That bed! 69 Serviced Apartments in Kyoto 37 Love Hotels in Kyoto 32 Villas in Kyoto 16 Capsule Hotels in Kyoto 11 Resorts in Kyoto 5 More about Kyoto The former imperial capital, Kyoto is a very important city in Japan's history. Many of the buildings and palaces in Kyoto are thousands of years old and the city is regarded by many to be the most beautiful in Japan. Kyoto has 17 areas listed as UNESCO World Heritage sites, most of which are temples and shrines like Kinkaku Temple . Kyoto Station is a popular entry point into the city and, as with most of Japan, the rail network provides access to all the city's most important sites. The two most impressive imperial retreats, Imperial Palace and Sentō Imperial Palace, are located in central Kyoto. The gardens are extensive and particularly beautiful during cherry blossom season and in autumn when the colors of the leaves change. Katsura Imperial Villa is located in Western Kyoto and Shugakuin Imperial Villa is located in the north. Kyoto's nightlife is concentrated around the Kiyamachi area in central Kyoto. There are hundreds of bars ranging from pubs to exclusive bars all throughout the area, as well as restaurants and night clubs. Kyoto is a city rich in history and charm, and visitors to this area will not be in want of exciting and interesting activities. There’s much more to see and learn about Kyoto, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.
